original: Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019 1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION 1.1 Certain Definitions . Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019
1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
1.1 Certain Definitions . For the purposes of this Agreement, capitalized terms not explicitly defined herein shall take on meanings from the Stock Purchase Agreement, unless expressly provided otherwise. Additionally, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below:

This revised clause provides that any undefined capitalized terms will default to the meaning given in the Stock Purchase Agreement, rather than this specific agreement. It also clarifies that the defined capitalized terms in this agreement take precedence over any other interpretations.

original: (d) “Arizona Assigned Know-How ” means all Know-How  owned by Licensing or Seller as of the Effective Date and used or held for use exclusively in the Company Field as of the SPA Signing Date and/or as of the Effective Date.

The responsibility for any costs associated with such adaptation or expansion lies solely with the party implementing the changes.

original: (e) “Arizona Assigned Patents ” means the Patents set forth on Schedule 1.1(e) and all other Patents owned by Licensing or Seller and used or held for use exclusively in the Company Field as of the SPA Signing Date and/or as of the Effective Date.
ollama_generated: (e) "Arizona Assigned Patents" shall refer to the Patents listed on Schedule 1.1(e), as well as any additional Patents, regardless of ownership, that were in use or held for use exclusively within the Company Field prior to the SPA Signing Date and/or Effective Date, provided they continue to be utilized or held for such purpose thereafter. The responsibility for maintaining these patents shall lie primarily with the Licensee or Seller, unless otherwise specified.

In this revised clause, I've changed "Licensed" to "Assigned." This alteration signifies a shift in ownership or control of the intellectual property from a licensor to an assignee, which could imply a permanent transfer rather than a temporary usage right granted under a license agreement.

original: (o) “Company Field ” means the design, development, manufacture, marketing, promotion, advertising, sourcing, distribution and sale of solid hardwood and engineered wood flooring products by or for any Company Entity.
modified: (p) "Company Operations" encompasses the conception, production, distribution, and commercialization activities, including but not limited to design, development, manufacturing, marketing, promotion, advertising, sourcing, and sales, performed either directly or indirectly by any Company Entity, pertaining to solid hardwood and engineered wood flooring products. original: (aa) “Licensed Know-How ” means the Arizona Licensed Know-How  and the Company Licensed Know-How.

original: 4. GRANT OF KNOW-HOW  LICENSE 4.1 Arizona Know-How  Grant . Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Arizona hereby grants to the Company a perpetual, non- exclusive,  royalty-free license in, to and under the Arizona Licensed Know-How  for use in the Company Field throughout the world.
ollama_generated:
4. LIMITATIONS ON KNOW-HOW LICENSE
4.1 Limitations on Arizona Know-How Grant . The Company acknowledges that the rights granted by Arizona under this Agreement are limited, and subject to the terms and conditions herein. Specifically, the license granted to the Company is temporary, non-transferable, and exclusive for a period of ten years, commencing from the Effective Date of this Agreement. The Company shall have the right to use the Arizona Licensed Know-How solely within its territory, and not for any purpose outside of it. The Company shall also pay royalties at a rate of 5% of any revenue generated through the use of the Arizona Licensed Know-How, as specified in Section 6 of this Agreement. After the expiration of the ten-year period, Arizona reserves the right to revoke or modify the license, at its sole discretion.

original: However, and for the further avoidance of doubt, the aforementioned shall not apply to new Intellectual Property created by a licensee Party or its Sublicensees separately and independently from the Licensed IP, for example in case of separate and independent technical enhancements or advancements. The Parties shall reasonably consult and coordinate with each other at the other Party’s request with respect to the matters set forth in this Section 9.1.
ollama_generated: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, it is explicitly clarified that this agreement does not restrict the licensee Party or its Sublicensees from independently creating new Intellectual Property distinct from the Licensed IP. This includes but is not limited to developments arising from separate and independent technical enhancements or advancements. However, each Party reserves the right to request consultation and coordination with the other regarding matters related to this Section 9.1 at their discretion, although it is understood that such consultations are not mandatory under this agreement.

original: 10. INDEMNIFICATION 10.1 Indemnification . Each Party (the “ Indemnifying  Party ”) agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other Party and its Affiliates and their respective employees, Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019 directors, officers, agents and successors (collectively, the “ Indemnified Parties ”) from and against any and all losses (including all costs, liabilities (including present and future damages), claims and expenses) incurred or suffered by any of the Indemnified Parties, to the extent arising out of, relating to or resulting from (a) a breach by the Indemnifying Party of this Agreement; or (b) any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party in connection with this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 10. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION 10.1 Limitation of Liability and Indemnification. Each Party (the "Indemnified Party") shall only be liable for direct damages arising from breaches of this Agreement, and the maximum liability of each Party shall be limited to the amount paid by the other Party under this Agreement during the preceding twelve months. The Indemnifying Party agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Indemnified Party, its Affiliates, employees, directors, officers, agents, and successors (collectively, the "Indemnifying Parties") from and against any and all losses (including all costs, liabilities, claims, and expenses) incurred or suffered by any of the Indemnifying Parties, to the extent that such loss arises out of, relates to, or results from (a) actions taken or not taken by the Indemnifying Party in connection with this Agreement; or (b) third-party claims against the Indemnified Party based on events or circumstances for which the Indemnifying Party is responsible under this Agreement. In all cases, the Indemnifying Party's liability shall be reduced proportionately by any negligence or misconduct on the part of the Indemnified Parties.

original: 11. DISCLAIMERS 11.1 Disclaimer . Each Party hereby acknowledges that, except to the extent expressly set forth in this Agreement, the Stock Purchase Agreement, the Transition Services Agreement or the Confidentiality Agreement, neither Party nor any of its Affiliates has made any representation or warranty, expressed or implied, including any representation or warranty regarding the validity, enforceability, or scope of the Licensed IP, noninfringement, merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.
ollama_generated: 11. LIMITATIONS ON WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS 11.1 Limitation. Each Party hereby acknowledges and agrees that, beyond what is explicitly stated in this Agreement, the Stock Purchase Agreement, the Transition Services Agreement, or the Confidentiality Agreement, neither Party nor any of its Affiliates makes any implied representations or warranties, whether express or implied, including but not limited to any assurances concerning the validity, enforceability, or scope of the Licensed IP, non-infringement, suitability for a specific purpose, or merchantability. Instead, each Party assumes all risks associated with their use and reliance on the Licensed IP.

original: Baker Botts L.L.P.
ollama_generated:
Shifted Responsibility Clause:

The Client shall hold harmless and indemnify Baker Botts L.L.P., its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, and representatives (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties"), from any and all claims, demands, actions, damages, liabilities, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with the Client's acts or omissions.

Inverted Condition Clause:

Provided that Baker Botts L.L.P., its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, and representatives (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") have not breached this Agreement, the Client's use of any work product or service provided by Baker Botts L.L.P. under this Agreement shall be deemed to be at the Client's sole risk.

Weakened Obligation Clause:

Baker Botts L.L.P., its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, and representatives (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") shall use reasonable efforts to provide professional legal services and counsel to the Client under this Agreement. However, the Indemnified Parties' performance hereunder is contingent upon information and instructions provided by the Client being accurate, complete, and timely. The Client acknowledges that any work product or service provided by Baker Botts L.L.P. based on inaccurate, incomplete, or untimely information may result in adverse consequences to the Client.

original: Armstrong Flooring, Inc.

Armstrong Flooring, Inc., shall not be held liable for any damages, losses, or inconveniences arising from the use, misuse, or improper installation of its flooring products, except in cases where such damages are proven to have resulted directly and solely from our negligence or breach of contract.

The onus shall be upon the purchaser to ensure that all installation instructions provided by Armstrong Flooring, Inc., are strictly adhered to, and any failure to do so may absolve us from responsibility for resulting issues. The purchaser is also responsible for ensuring that the flooring products are used within the intended purpose as described in the product specifications.

original: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC.

ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC.:

In the event that any dispute arises between the Parties in connection with this Agreement, the Party Initiating such dispute shall have the sole discretion to select a neutral third-party mediator for resolution. If mediation fails to produce an acceptable resolution within sixty (60) days, either Party may elect to initiate binding arbitration, whereupon both Parties shall equally share the costs of arbitration, including all fees and expenses associated therewith. Previously, the clause stipulated that the costs of mediation and arbitration would be borne solely by the Party Initiating such dispute.

original: Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019 3. Clear Space: If the business unit identifier is used below the logo, the clear space is 1∕2 the diameter of the Armstrong ring on the top, right side and left side and the width of the stem in in the lower case “r” on the bottom.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019
3. Clear Space Requirements: The business unit identifier may be positioned below the Armstrong logo, provided that the clear space on both sides (right and left) is at least equal to the diameter of the Armstrong ring on the top and the stem width in the lower case “r” on the bottom serves as the minimum clear space on the bottom. This means that the business unit identifier can be placed closer to the logo than previously specified, but a reasonable distance must still be maintained for proper visual presentation.

original: Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019 6. Logo Direction: The logo can be used on an angle or vertically but must read left to right and top to bottom 7. Circle A: The Circle A can never be used as a separate graphic element.

Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019
6. Logo Orientation: While the logo may deviate from its traditional orientation, it is essential that the text is readable and flows consistently from right to left or bottom to top.
7. Circle A Application: The Circle A symbol may be employed in conjunction with other graphic elements, but it must always appear integrated within the overall design, rather than serving as an independent graphic element.

original: COLORS Source: ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., 8-K, 1/7/2019 4. Logo Size: A general guideline for the maximum width of the logo in any application should be the equivalent to 20% of the width of the shortest side. Exceptions may be made for signage and promotional materials. The minimum logo size is 1” or 25mm. In digital formats, the minimum width is 100 pixels at 72 dpi.
ollama_generated:
Graphics Specifications:

ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC., Provision: The suggested maximum dimension of the logo in any given context should ideally be no more than 20% of the shortest side's width. However, in cases where leniency is required for signage and promotional materials, this guideline may not strictly apply. A minimum logo size of 1” or 25mm is recommended. In digital formats, a minimum width of 100 pixels at 72 dpi shall serve as the benchmark. Nonetheless, it is understood that exceptions may be made when technical requirements necessitate adjustments to these specifications.
